# Georgia House - Day 15 (2026-02-06)

## Overview
The session included remarks from the House Chaplain, Reverend Rose Marine Green, who discussed the importance of compassion for those in prison, drawing parallels to Jesus's own ministry and teachings.

## Key Actions
**HB 876**: [No description provided]  
**HB 385**: [No description provided]  
**HB 992**: [No description provided]  
**SB 63**: [No description provided]  
**SB 876**: [No description provided]  

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No new bills were introduced.

## Notable Moments
- Reverend Green offered condolences on the passing of Chairman Richard Smith.
- Reverend Green discussed Jesus's teachings on compassion for the imprisoned, and highlighted how influential figures like Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. found inspiration while incarcerated.

## Votes
No recorded votes were mentioned.

## Attendance
A quorum was present, as all members voted on the afternoon roll call.

## Adjournment
The session time and date of the next meeting were not provided.
